column4: hi, I think this may just be a general ubuntu issue but I can't seem to get my internet browsers to recognise any host entries I put in my /etc/hosts file - anyone having a similar issue?
if I ping the host addresses they work fine but in the browser it doesn't recognise the changes
does dns resolve when you ping google.com ?
so it wont go to the webby from the browser but it will resolve via terminal?
I did see a thread here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=317242 that spoke about some ipv6 issues with the /etc/hosts file
I tried them but no dice
just so you've got a context for this - I'm a web dev and I've got a dev site setup on another ip address and for some reason none of my browsers are recognising this address assignment in /etc/hosts
I was under the understanding that I could just override dns by specifying an ip address in /etc/hosts
its a lot easier than we thought
